import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.79918c60:
dataset.columns = [column.strip().lower() for column in dataset.columns]

dataset["species"] = dataset["species"].apply(lambda x: x.split("-")[-1].title())
source.e1b93786:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(7, 7))
fig.set_facecolor(background_color)
ax = fig.add_subplot()
ax.set_facecolor(background_color)
ax.grid(axis="y", color="#fff", linestyle="-", linewidth=1, zorder=0)
ax_colors = [purple_colors[1], green_colors[1], red_colors[1]]
sns.countplot(x="species", data=dataset, edgecolor=[purple_colors[-1], green_colors[-1], red_colors[-1]], linewidth=2, palette=ax_colors, zorder=2, ax=ax)
ax.set_xlabel("")
ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(labelsize=14, labelcolor="#fff", size=0, pad=7)
ax.set_ylabel("Count", fontsize=15, color="#fff", labelpad=7, fontfamily="serif")
ax.set_yticks(range(0, 50, 5))
ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelsize=12.5, labelcolor="#fff", size=0)
ax.set_title("Distribution of Iris' species\nin the dataset", fontsize=20, loc="left", color="#fff", y=1.05, fontweight="bold", fontfamily="serif")
for i, patch in enumerate(ax.patches):
    patch_x = patch.get_x()
    patch_height = patch.get_height()
    ax.annotate(text=patch_height, xy=(patch_x, patch_height+0.75), color=ax_colors[i], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=15, zorder=3)
hide_spines(ax)
fig.show()
source.e46d34e9:
features = dataset.columns[:-1].tolist()
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
fig.set_facecolor(background_color)
rows = 2
cols = 2
for i, feature in enumerate(features):
    data_feature = dataset[feature]
    data_feature_mean = data_feature.mean()
    ax = fig.add_subplot(rows, cols, i+1)
    ax.grid(axis="both", color="#fff", linestyle="-", linewidth=0.5, zorder=0)
    ax.set_facecolor(background_color)
    sns.kdeplot(x=data_feature, color=red_colors[1], fill=True, edgecolor=red_colors[-1], linewidth=2.5, alpha=1, zorder=2)
    ax.axvline(x=data_feature_mean, color="#fff", linewidth=1.5, label=f"Mean: {np.round(data_feature_mean, 3)}")
    ax.set_xlabel(feature, fontsize=14, color="#fff", labelpad=7, fontfamily="serif")
    ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(labelsize=12.5, labelcolor="#fff", size=0, pad=7)
    if i % cols == 0:
        ax.set_ylabel("Density", color="#fff", fontsize=14, labelpad=7, fontfamily="serif")
    else:
        ax.set_ylabel("")
    ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=11, size=0)
    ax.legend(fontsize=11, facecolor=background_color, labelcolor="#fff", borderpad=0.5, framealpha=1)
    hide_spines(ax)

fig.text(x=0.05, y=1.025, s="Features Distributions Analysis", fontsize=20, fontweight="bold", fontfamily="serif", color="#fff")
fig.tight_layout(w_pad=3, h_pad=3)
fig.show()
source.2b33f362:
correlations = dataset.corr()
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(5, 5))
fig.set_facecolor(background_color)
ax = fig.add_subplot()
ax.set_facecolor(background_color)
sns.heatmap(correlations, vmax=.5, annot=True, square=True, cbar=False, ax=ax)
ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=14, size=0)
ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=14, size=0)
ax.set_title("Correlation Matrix", fontsize=20, fontweight="bold", color="#fff", y=1.05, fontfamily="serif", loc="left")
fig.show()
source.9eacd698:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
fig.set_facecolor(background_color)
rows = 2
cols = 2
for i, feature in enumerate(features):
    ax = fig.add_subplot(rows, cols, i+1)
    ax.grid(axis="both", color="#fff", linestyle="-", linewidth=0.5, zorder=0)
    ax.set_facecolor(background_color)
    sns.kdeplot(x=feature, data=dataset, hue="species", palette=ax_colors, fill=True, edgecolor=background_color, linewidth=2, alpha=1, zorder=2)
    ax.set_xlabel(feature, fontsize=14, color="#fff", labelpad=7, fontfamily="serif")
    ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(labelsize=12.5, labelcolor="#fff", size=0, pad=7)
    if i % cols == 0:
        ax.set_ylabel("Density", color="#fff", fontsize=14, labelpad=7, fontfamily="serif")
    else:
        ax.set_ylabel("")
    ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=11, size=0)
    hide_spines(ax)
    ax.legend().set_visible(False)

fig.text(x=0.66, y=1.045, s="Setosa", color=ax_colors[0], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=15)
fig.text(x=0.75, y=1.045, s="Versicolor", color=ax_colors[1], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=15)
fig.text(x=0.88, y=1.045, s="Virginica", color=ax_colors[2], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=15)
fig.text(x=0.05, y=1.025, s="Features & Species Distributions\nAnalysis", fontsize=20, fontweight="bold", fontfamily="serif", color="#fff")
fig.tight_layout(w_pad=3, h_pad=3)
fig.show()
source.e18d182e:
rows = 4
cols = 4
fig, axes = plt.subplots(rows, cols, figsize=(12, 12))
fig.set_facecolor(background_color)
for i, feature1 in enumerate(features):
    for j, feature2 in enumerate(features):
        ax = axes[i, j]
        ax.set_facecolor(background_color)
        if j > i:
            ax.set_xticks([])
            ax.set_yticks([])
            hide_spines(ax)
            
        else:
            
            sns.scatterplot(x=feature2, y=feature1, data=dataset, hue="species", palette=ax_colors, zorder=2, ax=ax)        
            
            if i == (rows - 1):
                ax.set_xlabel(feature2, fontsize=13, labelpad=7, color="#fff", fontfamily="serif")
            else:
                ax.set_xlabel("")
                
            ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(size=0, labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=10)
            
            if j == 0:
                ax.set_ylabel(feature1, fontsize=13, labelpad=7, color="#fff", fontfamily="serif")
            else:
                ax.set_ylabel("")
                
            ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(size=0, labelcolor="#fff", labelsize=10)
            hide_spines(ax)
            
            ax.grid(axis="both", color="#fff", linestyle="-", linewidth=0.5, zorder=0)
            ax.legend().set_visible(False)

            
fig.text(s="Numeric Features\n& Species Relationships", x=0.55, y=0.9, color="#fff", fontweight="bold", fontsize=25, fontfamily="serif")
fig.text(x=0.86, y=0.785, s="Setosa", color=ax_colors[0], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=20)
fig.text(x=0.82, y=0.82, s="Versicolor", color=ax_colors[1], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=20)
fig.text(x=0.8325, y=0.855, s="Virginica", color=ax_colors[2], fontfamily="serif", fontsize=20)
fig.tight_layout(pad=3)
fig.show()

source.bba094d7:
# Introducing to the dataset

It includes three iris species with 50 samples each as well as some properties about each flower. One flower species is linearly separable from the other two, but the other two are not linearly separable from each other.

The columns in this dataset are:
Id - observation identifier
SepalLengthCm - sepal length in cm
SepalWidthCm - sepal width in cm
PetalLengthCm - petal length in cm
PetalWidthCm - petal width in cm
Species - Iris's species (Setosa, Versicolor, Virginica)

Some Information about Iris plant

Iris is a genus of 260–300 species of flowering plants with showy flowers. It takes its name from the Greek word for a rainbow, which is also the name for the Greek goddess of the rainbow, Iris. Some authors state that the name refers to the wide variety of flower colors found among the many species. As well as being the scientific name, iris is also widely used as a common name for all Iris species, as well as some belonging to other closely related genera. A common name for some species is 'flags', while the plants of the subgenus Scorpiris are widely known as 'junos', particularly in horticulture. It is a popular garden flower. The often-segregated, monotypic genera Belamcanda (blackberry lily, I. domestica), Hermodactylus (snake's head iris, I. tuberosa), and Pardanthopsis (vesper iris, I. dichotoma) are currently included in Iris. Three Iris varieties are used in the Iris flower data set outlined by Ronald Fisher in his 1936 paper The use of multiple measurements in taxonomic problems as an example of linear discriminant analysis.

If you don't know how to calculate the width and length of sepals and petals, this image will be helpful.
